overview_of_class: Genetics and Molecular Biology. Principles of inheritance; methods used to study gene function; mechanisms by which DNA is replicated, transcribed into RNAs, and translated into proteins; basics of the process of natural selection.
name: Genetics and Molecular Biology
title: WCAS BIOL_SCI 215-0-01 Genetics and Molecular Biology
enrl_requirement: Enrollment Requirements: Prerequisite: Students must have taken CHEM 102-0 or CHEM 171-0 to register for this course.

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Genetics and Molecular Biology. Principles of inheritance; methods used to study gene function; mechanisms by which DNA is replicated, transcribed into RNAs, and translated into proteins; basics of the process of natural selection.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Three hours per week of lecture; Wednesday evening group work meetings.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Three midterm exams (two on Wednesday evenings and one during finals week) and weekly assignments. Attendance on the first day is mandatory.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
Hardcover text+ Portal+Solutions Manual+Launch Pad - Griffiths, 11th Ed., Introduction to Genetic Analysis : ISBN 9781319066109

Looseleaf text+Portal+Solutions Manual+Launch Pad - Griffiths, 11th Ed., Introduction to Genetic Analysis : ISBN 9781319050016


Note: LaunchPad is included at no extra cost.

Response Card NXT

descriptions.name: Class Notes
descriptions.value:
Attendance on the first day is mandatory. WCAS Distro Area 1- Natural Sciences

Final Exams for both lecture sections will be held jointly.
